Authors: Hanafiah N., Wijaya I., Xavier S., Young C.G., Adrianto D., Shodiq M.
Title: Itinerary recommendation generation using enhanced simulated annealing algorithm
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hanafiah, N., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wijaya, I., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Xavier, S., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Young, C.G., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Adrianto, D., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Shodiq, M., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The trend of traveling has increased in recent years along with the easy access to information. Travelers create the itinerary before they are travelling to an area. However, creating itinerary is not easy, many factors need to be considered before deciding where to go, such as the “must visited” places in that area, distance between tourist attractions to be visited within a day, preferred tourist attractions, and other information about the places. Generating the optimized distance itinerary is similar as a Traveling Salesman Problem (TSP). The purpose of this research is to study the combination of simulated annealing and Greedy algorithms to create an itinerary. The initialization process of the simulated annealing algorithm uses Greedy algorithm searching technique and then proceeded with existing optimization step in simulated annealing method. This paper proposed a method of enhanced simulated annealing algorithm and the experiment results show the enhanced simulated annealing increase the effectiveness of simulated annealing algorithm which produce the shortest distance needed to travel places around an area. © 2019 The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V.
Author Keywords: Greedy algorithm; Itinerary generator; Simulated annealing; Travel plan
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Traveling salesman problem; Greedy algorithms; Itinerary generator; Searching techniques; Simulated annealing algorithms; Simulated annealing method; Tourist attractions; Travel plans; Simulated annealing

Authors: Adrianto D., Hidajat M., Yesmaya V.
Title: Augmented reality using Vuforia for marketing residence
Source title: 2016 1st International Conference on Game, Game Art, and Gamification, ICGGAG 2016
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adrianto, D., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Hidajat, M., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Yesmaya, V., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The concept of Augmented Reality is a technology in which the interaction between the human-computer that can generate two-dimensional or three dimensional object in real time. Augmented reality can provide the necessary functions and information in its application. In this case the augmented reality (AR) just need a tool like a camera that can capture images by detecting the object without the marker coordinates from the surrounding environment to make real 3D objects. Augmented Reality application development is simple and easy to develop, so it can serve as a promotional tool or the provision of information. Therefore, the notion obtained separately develop AR applications that help the residence marketing department in the home market to show a 3D object of marketed house. So that prospective buyers get the information more interactive with real look 3D objects. This study use a software named Vuforia (QCAR) to implement augmented reality in mobile applications for marketing residence. Vuforia provides convenience to the Android mobile platform in the shooting in 3D objects. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: android; augmented reality; markerless; marketing residence; real environment; vuforia
Index Keywords: Android (operating system); Application programs; Commerce; Human computer interaction; Marketing; Object detection; android; Augmented reality applications; Markerless; Marketing departments; Real environments; Surrounding environment; Three-dimensional object; vuforia; Augmented reality

Authors: Adrianto D., Luwinda F.A., Yesmaya V.
Title: Augmented Reality Implementation in Watch Catalog as e-Marketing Based on Mobile Aplication
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adrianto, D., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Luwinda, F.A., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Yesmaya, V., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: Augmented Reality is one of important methods to provide user with a better interactive user interface. In this research, Augmented Reality in Mobile Application will be applied to provide user with useful information related with Watch Catalogue. This research will be focused on design and implementation an application using Augmented Reality. The process model used in this research is Extreme Programming. Extreme Programming have a several steps which are planning, design, coding, and testing. The result of this research is Augmented Reality application based on Android. This research will be conclude that implementation of Augmented Reality based on Android in Watch Catalogue will help customer to collect the useful information related to the specific object of watch. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Android (operating system); User interfaces; Watches; Augmented reality applications; Design and implementations; E-marketing; EXtreme Programming; Interactive user interfaces; Mobile applications; Process Modeling; Augmented reality

Authors: Adrianto D., Yesmaya V., Chandra A.
Title: Increasing learning frequency through education based game
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adrianto, D., Department of Computer Science, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Yesmaya, V., Department of Computer Science, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Chandra, A., Department of Computer Science, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: In the era of globalization, the development of the gaming world is evident very quickly, evidenced by the launch of various types of games every year, even every month. Game development that grows rapidly makes the desire to incorporate educational elements into the game application. It is also supported by the development of game engine to facilitate game development. The purpose of this research is to build an education based game on PC platform using Unity3D Game Engine (the newest game engine) to increase the learning frequency. The result achieved in this result is the creation of an educational based game app as a medium of study by combining the concept of the game and learning in it. Conclusion obtained after doing this research is that education based game can be made to increase the learning frequency. © 2015 Dennise Adrianto, Violitta Yesmaya and Alvin Chandra.
Author Keywords: Education based game; Game; Learning frequency; Unity3D

Title: Comparison using particle Swarm optimization and genetic algorithm for timetable scheduling
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, School of Computer Science Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adrianto, D., Department of Computer Science, School of Computer Science Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Lecturer timetable scheduling is an important part in the resource allocation planning. Due to the large amount of transactions and various related constraints have to be taken into account in timetable scheduling process, resource manager team shall need a lot of time to the solve the problem. This research is aimed to discuss the application of Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO) that can be used to automatically generate optimal lecturer timetable scheduling. Using Software Laboratory Center (SLC) data, some hard constraints are taken into account such as the assistant should teach according to their qualifications, teaching in their work shift and doesn't teach any course that are being taken. Some soft constraints are also considered and the associated cost function is built based on these hard and soft constraints. Based on the computational results, the amount of penalty obtained by the PSO is much smaller than the GA on 500th iteration. The calculation is performed by comparing the amount of penalty that earned each time a hard constraint or soft constraint is violated by the implementation of PSO or GA to the total penalty obtained when all constraints are violated. © 2014 Science Publications.
Author Keywords: Hard constraints; Particle swarm optimization; Soft constraints; Timetable scheduling

Authors: Santika D.D., David, Adrianto D., Luwinda F.A.
Title: DT-CWT and neural network for face recognition
Affiliations: Information Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya 27, Kebon Jeruk Jakarta Barat 11530, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Santika, D.D., Information Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya 27, Kebon Jeruk Jakarta Barat 11530, Indonesia; David, Information Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya 27, Kebon Jeruk Jakarta Barat 11530, Indonesia; Adrianto, D., Information Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya 27, Kebon Jeruk Jakarta Barat 11530, Indonesia; Luwinda, F.A., Information Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya 27, Kebon Jeruk Jakarta Barat 11530, Indonesia
Abstract: Dual Tree Complex Wavelet Transform (DT-CWT) is improvement of Discrete Wavelet Transform DWT), where DWT have some weaknesses that DT-CWT can solved that problem. DT-CWT can be used as extracted feature of image. DT-CWT can reduce the dimension of highly dimensional data such as large image. This paper use DT-CWT as feature extraction to obtain feature. This paper use Neural Network for recognition and using extracted feature as input and discuss about finding the effective number of node in Neural Network. Through this research, it can be concluded that one hidden layer give better accuracy compared to two hidden layers. A few number of nodes give same result of large number of nodes. The number of each hidden layer not influence the accuracy, but with few numbers of nodes has better time process. © 2012 Elsevier B.V.
